box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font:
✅ be 動詞は省略されることがある
感情が激昂したとき
You are a liar!
手短に切れくよく発言したいとき
Is Everything OK?

switch.text: ✅ be 動詞は省略されることがある...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 275px; height: 1px; padding-top: 47px; margin-left: 2px;

div.font:
トレーニングを積むしかない事項
✅ どの動詞がどの文型でどう使われるのか

switch.text: トレーニングを積むしかない事項✅ どの動詞がどの文型でどう使われるのか...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 157px; height: 1px; padding-top: 891px; margin-left: 300px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 157px; height: 1px; padding-top: 762px; margin-left: 468px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 157px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1103px; margin-left: 468px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 157px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1203px; margin-left: 468px;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 157px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1203px; margin-left: 636px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 157px; height: 1px; padding-top: 859px; margin-left: 636px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 393px; height: 1px; padding-top: 760px; margin-left: 807px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font:
✅ 他動型のもつ強い「及ぶ」感触
[他] I know Monet. (深い知識を持っている)
[自] I know about Monet. (印象派だな、光の画家だな、くらいの知っている感)
[自] I know of Monet. ( あー聞いたころあるなー。建築やってんだっけ？くらい)
[他] He shot the bird. (彼は鳥を 撃った)
[自] He shot at the bird. (彼は鳥をめがけて撃った)
✅ 目的語説明文
(名詞) Just call me Ken.
(形容詞) He smashed the lock open.
(前置詞句) I saw a cockroach in the kitchen.
(ing 形) I saw the players training.
(過去分詞) Harry saw Lucy bullied by her classmate.
(知覚動詞 + 動詞原形) I saw Mary cross the street.
(知覚動詞 + 動詞原形) Didn't you hear the phone ring?
(使役動詞) I'll do anything to make you happy.
(使役動詞) I had my hair cut.
(使役動詞) Don't let me down.
(使役動詞 + 動詞原形) I'll have my secretary fax it to you rightaway.
(使役動詞 + 動詞原形) The PE tacher made the students run in the snow.
(使役動詞 + 動詞原形) My daughter's upset because I won't let her get a tattoo.
(get + to 不定詞) I got one of my classmates to help my sister with her homowork.
(to 不定詞) My parents always tell me to study harder!

switch.text: ✅ 他動型のもつ強い「及ぶ」感触...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 393px; height: 1px; padding-top: 959px; margin-left: 1214px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font:
✅ レポート文
(that 節) Tom said to me he loved me.
(that 節) I think Mary is gorgeous.
(whether/if 節) I didn't know whether/if you had already paid the bill.
✅ say, hear, tell などのコミュニケーション動詞では、しばしば現在形が優先される
She says she isn't going to marry him.
I hear that the PTA is going to hold a fund-raising concert next month.
Kaori tells me that Kenji is going to be expelled from school.
✅ レポート文
(that 節) I'm so sad he lost his job.
(that 節) I'm afraid we cannot give you a refund.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 705px; margin-left: 133px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font:
✅ なんでも主語に
ing 形、to 不定詞、節、前置詞
Under the doormat is ~~~.
✅ 標準は単純な (代) 名詞
to 不定詞や節は高尚なイメージ
✅ 友達同士などで主語省略
Are you Enjoying the party?
I Hope you recover soon!
✅ 命令文
(高圧) Concentrate!
(勧め) Take a look at it.
✅ 無生物主語 → 便利
The news made us all excited.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 275px; height: 1px; padding-top: 345px; margin-left: 733px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font:
✅ 単数 or 複数
(単/複) My family are/is all into skiing.
最近の米英語では単数
(複) The rich are sometimes stingy.
(単) 20 cigarettes is a lot to smoke in a day.
(単) I hope every customer is satisfied.
(単) In golf, Each player keeps their own score.

span.font:
✅ 数量表現
(肯定) a lot of, a few, a little
(否定/疑問) many, much, few, little
ただし、so や too , very が付随すると強くなるので、肯定文でも使える
✅その他
No について、複数は普通だが、単数を使うとより強烈な否定表現となる

div.font: not を使うところで NO を使うと、全く違う感が出る

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 889px; height: 1px; padding-top: 160px; margin-left: 132px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 311px; height: 1px; padding-top: 339px; margin-left: 133px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font:
✅ Determiner
■ なし
(総称表現) Crows are highly intelligent birds.
(総称表現) I like wine.
(リストアップ) We need poster paper, marker pens, and glue.
■ The
(文脈) I met Karen's boyfriend last night. The guy is not friendly at all.
(目前) Close the door!
(常識) 70% of the earth's surface is covered by water.
(常識) Which way is the restroom?
(唯一) She was the first Japanese woman to travel into space.
(唯一) Who is the youngest of the three?
(集団) Look at the penguins ovet there.
(一家) The Yamadas are moving to Indonesia.
(唯一) Sharon is the woman for the job.
(唯一) The New York Times
(ピン) John plays the flute and the clarinet.
(ピン) The police were quickly on the scene.
(ピン) I don't often listen to the radio.
(ピン) Do you prefer the town or the country?
(ピン) I want to live in a house on the river.
(ピン) I think you should see the doctor.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 290px; height: 1px; padding-top: 350px; margin-left: 451px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font:
■ a [an]
(初出) You know I bought a new iPod?
(初出) Karen's got a new boyfriend.
(不特定) I need to find a part-time job.
(職業) Mary is a nurse.
(1/x) This is a present that he gave me.
(1/x) She gave me a reason why she left him.■ some
(数〇の) There are some squirrels in your garden.
(いくらか) I need some olive oil for the salad.
(いる) Some people never learn from experience.
(もいる) Some are cheap and others are expensive.
(あるよ) Would you like some coffee?
(あるよ) Do you need some assistance?
(興味なし) She ran off with some guy from Italy!
(隠したい) Some guy told me.
■ any
(どれでも) Any parent would want the best for their child.
(どれでも) He's more talented than any player I've coached.
(どれでも) Choose any card.
(疑問文に) Do you have any other questions?
(疑問文に) Do you have any money?
(どんなも) I don't like any sports.
(どんなも) I don't need any advace.

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
